page.title: 18Sunderland Point/Sea/Nature
page.content: The sea and the Lune Estuary dominate Sunderland Point. The glacial boulder clay of the tip of the Point is eroding rapidly through the action of the sea, but parts of the beaches near the village are accreting. Two severe storms within l0 years, in l977 and l983, have accelerated the erosion as well as inundating half the houses and damaging household belongings and field and garden walls. The estuary is silting. Siltation caused by the construction of river training walls about l00 years ago is almost complete,but a new phase of rapid silting is in progress due to the colonisation of the higher intertidal silt areas by marsh grass, spartina. The only road to the village is tidal being covered for up to 4 hours. The area has many wild plants, and is rich in bird life, particularly waders
